data.sentence: The Pentagon's research arm has pumped $1 million into a contract to build an _AI_ tool meant to decode and predict the emotions of allies and enemies. It even wants the _AI_ app to advise generals on major military decisions

data.sentence: Because humans are susceptible to bias from their own personal baggage, _AI_ can make a more objective decision on someone’s feelings. And so it can help people make better decisions on how to communicate: _AI_ will actually make us more human
data.source: Matt Celuszak, CEO of Element Human, in Forbes

data.sentence: I’m increasingly inclined to think that there should be some regulatory oversight, maybe at the national and international level, just to make sure that we don’t do something very foolish. I mean with _AI_ we’re summoning the demon.

data.sentence: I'm more frightened than interested by _AI_ - in fact, perhaps fright and interest are not far away from one another. Things can become real in your mind, you can be tricked, and you believe things you wouldn't ordinarily
data.source: Gemma Whelan, cited in '28 best quotes about AI' in Forbes
